key_insight: Surface RPM variation during MWD-confirmed stick-slip events was ±1 rpm while downhole PKtoPK oscillation reached 381 rpm — a 380× attenuation by the drill string acting as a torsional spring. This demonstrates why downhole MWD data is essential for reliable stick-slip detection in this well.

signals.mwd_downhole: 50% weight — primary ground truth (MWD PKtoPK RPM)
signals.surface_torque: 40% weight — continuous proxy (torque deviation from rolling baseline)
signals.surface_rpm: 10% weight — attenuated but still present (std/mean RPM)
